thread.title: Nashua man presented United Way award
thread.title_full: Nashua man presented United Way award

author: onlineeditor@nashuatelegraph.com (The Nashua Telegraph)
title: Nashua man presented United Way award
text:
Sunday, October 18, 2015 Nashua man presented United Way award NASHUA - The United Way of Greater Nashua recognized longtime Nashua resident Rolf Goodwin with the Max I. Silber Award during its annual Day of Caring in September. Goodwin's commitment to community service has spanned decades, beginning with his introduction to United Way and giving back as a young man growing up in eastern Pennsylvania. Goodwin became engaged with United Way of Greater Nashua as an associate with the Hamblett & Kerrigan law firm, and has been a contributor and volunteer ever since. ... Get more information at nashuatelegraph.com/fullaccess Sign up or Login NASHUA - The United Way of Greater Nashua recognized longtime Nashua resident Rolf Goodwin with the Max I. Silber Award during its annual Day of Caring in September. Goodwin's commitment to community service has spanned decades, beginning with his introduction to United Way and giving back as a young man growing up in eastern Pennsylvania. Goodwin became engaged with United Way of Greater Nashua as an associate with the Hamblett & Kerrigan law firm, and has been a contributor and volunteer ever since. "Rolf has been a loyal and committed United Way volunteer for many, many years," the United Way said in a statement. "His passion for giving back to the community is evident in everything he does and is a true inspiration to those around him. "We are very lucky and blessed to have Rolf with us working side by side to help the United Way in its mission to make measurable improvements in the communities we serve. Goodwin's long history of service to community includes: Nashua Symphony Chorus - Member. Leadership Greater Nashua - Member of the inaugural class (1995). Harvard Club of New Hampshire - Director, vice president and chairman of the Admissions Committee. Harvard Pierian Foundation (Harvard-Radcliffe Orchestra) - Treasurer and chairman. Parents and Children Together - Chairman and co-founder. Symphony New Hampshire - Trustee, chairman of the Strategic Planning Committee. N.H. State Bar Association - Chairman of the Ethics Committee. 501hub - Chairman and co-founder. NH Charitable Foundation, Nashua Region - Incorporator. United Way of Greater Nashua - Director, chairman of the board, chairman of the Priorities Committee, chairman of the Community Assessment Committee, chairman of the Strategic Planning Committee, member of the Community Investment Committee and Day of Caring volunteer. The Silber Award is presented to members of the Greater Nashua community who exemplify the ideals of community service and volunteerism. Established in 1988, the awards serves as recognition of the many years of community service given to the residents of Greater Nashua by Max Silber, who volunteered for numerous local nonprofits. "I am honored to receive this award from United Way, which is such an effective force for good in our community," Goodwin said. "I look forward to our next efforts together, especially focusing on unleashing the energy and talent of refugees and immigrants as we welcome them into 'One Nashua.' " Goodwin is an tireless advocate for children and the arts, and is a director at McLane Middleton law firm in Manchester. Top Jobs
